items.title: Natural Science Program

items.title: Software Development Intern
items.description:
Worked on Collabrik, A cloud based product for cross-platform content planning,
          with developing a proof of concept for integrating Facebook and Google analytics.
          (React, Redux, D3.js, Google Analytics)

items.title: Study Catalyst
items.location: KTH Royal Institute of Technology - Stockholm, Sweden
items.description:
Catalyst and study group leader for first year students at
          KTH Royal Institute of Technology in their Introductory Maths course with the
          aim to integrate them in University level maths.

items.title: Tutor
items.description: Tutor in Maths and Physics for Swedish High School students.

items.title: First Cycle Degree Project
items.location: KTH Royal Institute of Technology - Stockholm, Sweden
items.description: Master of Science degree in Computer Science with main track Software Technology.

items.title: Editor in Chief
items.description:
Head of Editorial in a student project group with the goal of giving students insight
          to working life in Sweden as well as abroad. My work is leading and coordinating documentation
          of the project in text and photography.

items.title: Editor in Chief
items.description:
I run the Computer Science chapter newspaper and podcast.
          The newspaper is mostly satirical and with a joking touch, however it is a superb outlet for creativity.

items.title: Marketing Manager
items.description:
DKM is a group of Computer Science students which are responsible for organizing
           student events such as pubs, dinners, gatherings, parties and so forth. My task was to manage our
            marketing and design for the events planned by us.

items.title: Mentor
items.description:
Mentored 15 first year computer science students during the six week long reception.
           Also consists of planning events for the new students to attend.

items.title: Industry Contact
items.description:
Event manager (2015) - Planned lunch seminars and co-planned the Computer Science
           job fair. 
 Industry Contact (2014-2015) - In contact with the industry to arrange events for students and companies. 

           Host (2014) - Host for two companies at the Computer Science job fair
